title: Bunnie Xo Exposes the Wholesome Fun Jelly Roll Got Up to While She Was Away for 12Â Hours
summary: "When the cat's away, the mice will play," the country star cheers in a clip shared by the podcaster.
body: When Bunnie Xo left Jelly Roll to his own devices while she was away on a recent trip to Las Vegas, he partied like an animal — well, more like he partied with animals. Related Jelly Roll Receives Pardon for Past Crimes From Tennessee Gov. Lee Jelly Roll Opens Up About Losing Weight to Improve Sex Life With Bunnie Xo: ‘I Couldn’t Even Get Aroused’ Jelly Roll & Bunnie Xo Go to Prom for the First Time Ever, Thanks to 17-Year-Old Daughter: ‘She Crowned Us King & Queen’ In an adorable video the podcaster shared to Instagram on Monday (Dec. 29), she playfully exposes the wholesome fun her country-star husband got up to while she was away. “Me and the crew flew into Vegas last night, and I woke up this morning to a series of videos from my husband of what’s going on at the farm while we’re gone,” Bunnie began before sharing the clips Jelly sent her. The camera then cuts to shots — filmed by Jelly — of the couple’s pet cows, Crunch and S’more, escaping their corrals and running around as helpers try to get them back inside. “Crunch has gotten out,” the singer says, cacklâ€¦

title: Jazz Group Cancels Kennedy Center New Yearâ€™s Eve Concert AfterÂ Renaming
summary: In a message announcing the cancellation, The Cookers said the group was committed â€œto playing music that reaches across divisions rather than deepening them.â€
body: More artists have canceled scheduled performances at the Kennedy Center following the addition of President Donald Trumpâ€™s name to the facility, with jazz supergroup The Cookers pulling out of a planned New Yearâ€™s Eve concert, and the institutionâ€™s president saying the cancellations belie the artistsâ€™ unwillingness to see their music as crossing lines of political disparity. Related Kennedy Center President to ‘Seek $1 Million in Damages’ From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show KISS, Michael Crawford, Gloria Gaynor Talk 2025 Kennedy Center Honors: ‘It’s Not Only About What You Get From People, It’s What You Give Them’ Donald Trump Takes Center Stage at 2025 Kennedy Center Honors Featuring Awards for KISS, Gloria Gaynor & More The fresh round of cancellations after Trump put his name on the building follows an earlier artist backlash in spring. After Trump ousted the Kennedy Center board and named himself the institutionâ€™s chairman in February, performer Issa Rae and the producers of â€œHamiltonâ€ cancelled scheduled engagements while musicians Ben Folds and Renee Fleming stepped down from advisory roles. The Cooâ€¦

title: Hereâ€™s How to Watch Jason Aldean, Lainey Wilson & Bailey Zimmerman PerformÂ at New Yearâ€™s Eve Live: Nashvilleâ€™s Big BashÂ OnlineÂ forÂ Free
summary: The live event will feature a ton of musical guests from the country genre.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Looking to celebrate the New Year the country way? Nashville is throwing a big bash and you’re cordially invited. CBS is bringing the fireworks and New Year’s cheer to TV screens everywhere with New Year’s Eve Live: Nashville’s Big Bash. The show is set to air live on Wednesday, Dec. 31, 8:00-10:00 PM, ET/PT, 10:30 PM-1:30 AM, ET/PT on the CBS Television Network. If you happen to miss out on the festivities, not to worry, the show will also be available to stream via Paramount+ . Comedian and actor Bert Kreischer and country music star HARDY will be hosting the event, partying hard with musical guests like Jason Aldean, Lainey Wilson and Bailey Zimmerman, and special guests CeCe Winans and the Fisk Jubilee Singers. “You hear people say, ‘I’m honored and privileged to be working with a certain group of people,’ but in this case, I am blown away that I’m allowed to work with these people. This lineâ€¦

title: Bad Bunny & RaiNaoâ€™s â€˜Perfumito Nuevoâ€™ Claims No. 1 Spot â€” And MakesÂ History
summary: The song, Benitoâ€™s sixth No. 1 from his album DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos, gives RaiNao her first Latin Airplay chart-topper.
body: Just two months after topping Billboard â€™s Latin Airplay chart, Bad Bunny returns to the summit with â€œPerfumito Nuevoâ€ on the chart dated Jan. 3, 2026. The track, with RaiNao , ascends 6-1 and gives the Puerto Rican singer-songwriter her first career No. 1 on the overall Latin radio ranking. It’s the sixth No. 1 from Bad Bunny’s DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos album â€” making him the first male artist to yield six No. 1s from a single album. Only one other album, Shakira’s Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran , has produced more No. 1s, with seven between 2022-24. â€œPerfumito Nuevoâ€ leads with the Greatest Gainer honors after a 61% gain in audience impressions, up 10.1 million, earned in the United States during the Dec. 19-25 tracking week, according to Luminate. In sum, five artists (with eight different albums) generated at least five No. 1s from a single album since Latin Airplay launched in 1994. Here is the list: Artist, Album, No. 1s (Years the Songs Went to No. 1) Bad Bunny, DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos , six (2025-26) Bad Bunny, Un Verano Sin T i, five (2019-23) Enrique Iglesias, Enrique Iglesias , five (1995-96) Enrique Iglesias, Final (Vol. 1) , five (2015-21) Karol G, KG0516 , five (â€¦

title: Curiosity Sends Holiday Postcard from Mars
summary: Team members working with NASAâ€™s Curiosity Mars rover created this â€œpostcardâ€ by commanding the rover to take images at two times of day on Nov. 18, 2025, spanning periods that occurred on both the 4,722nd and 4,723rd Martian days, or sols, of the mission. The panoramas were captured at 4:15 p.m. oâ€¦
body: NASA/JPL-Caltech Team members working with NASAâ€™s Curiosity Mars rover created this â€œpostcardâ€ by commanding the rover to take images at two times of day on Nov. 18, 2025, spanning periods that occurred on both the 4,722nd and 4,723rd Martian days, or sols, of the mission. The panoramas were captured at 4:15 p.m. on Sol 4,722 and 8:20 a.m. on Sol 4,723 (both at local Mars time), then merged together. Color was later added for an artistic interpretation of the scene with blue representing the morning panorama and yellow representing the afternoon one. The resulting â€œpostcardâ€ is similar to ones the rover took in June 2023 and November 2021 . Adding color to these kinds of merged images helps different details stand out in the landscape. Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech

title: From Justin Bieber to Drake, Big Sean Breaks Down His Favorite Features of AllÂ Time
summary: After a sizzling 2025 run with over 20 guest appearances, Big Sean sits down with Billboard to unpack his favorite verses of the year and of all time.
body: For over 15 years, Big Sean has built a career off of scintillating punchlines and scene-stealing features. From trading bars with rap heavyweights like Drake, Jay-Z and Ye to gliding effortlessly alongside pop titans such as Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande, Seanâ€™s pen comes equipped with laser-sharp precision, and has never gone cold. â€œI take pride in being able to collab with Gucci Mane, Eminem, Young Thug, Justin Bieber, Calvin Harris, and still feel completely natural,â€ Sean tells Billboard . â€œNone of it ever feels forced, or else I wouldnâ€™t do it. Itâ€™s always been about respecting the music and trusting the process.â€ In 2025, Sean put that skill set on full display — flexing his lyrical muscles across more than 20 features, and reaffirming why his Detroit-bred motor still runs at championship speed. From lyrical sparring matches with Dave East and Russ to a heartfelt nod to childhood icon Will Smith, Seanâ€™s elastic wordplay and technical dexterity continue to keep listeners locked in, anticipating his next verse. â€œEarly in my career, it was always a dream to work with Nas, Eminem, Jay-Z, Ye and Wayne,â€ Sean says. â€œIâ€™ve been fortunate enough to check most of those off â€” â€¦

title: Taylor Swift Shocks Employee With Generous Tip at Christmas Day Chiefs Game: â€˜My Whole Paycheck for 2Â Weeksâ€™
summary: "My mind just froze," the Arrowhead Stadium worker recalled.
body: While cheering on Travis Kelce at the Christmas Day football game between the Kansas City Chiefs and Denver Broncos, Taylor Swift made one employee’s holiday a lot more merry and bright. Related Taylor Swift Supports an Emotional Travis Kelce at His Last Chiefs Home Game of the Season Travis Kelce Reveals One of Taylor Swift’s Favorite Gifts From Him So Far A Timeline of Taylor Swift’s Generosity According to Robyn Gentry, who posted Sunday (Dec. 28) on Facebook about working at Arrowhead Stadium during the match-up three days prior, the pop star gave her a hefty tip, which Billboard has confirmed. “She was running around telling everyone merry Christmas and came towards me, saying thank you so much for working on Christmas, please take this, Merry Christmas,” Gentry wrote. “My mind just froze,” the employee continued. “Of course I said merry Christmas and thank you so much. Travis and her were smiling so big and just kept saying merry Christmas, thank you for working Christmas … I stopped to look at what was in my handâ€¦. $600. My whole paycheck for two weeks.” “I had just dropped that much for Christâ€¦

title: â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ Singers Reveal Their Wildest â€˜Pinch Meâ€™ Moments of 2025 After a Truly â€˜Goldenâ€™ Year
summary: Charlie Puth, Demi Lovato and more also shared memories of the past 12 months with Billboard.
body: Arguably no one had a more golden year than the stars of KPop Demon Hunters â€” and in an interview with Billboard ahead of their performance on Dick Clarkâ€™s New Yearâ€™s Rockinâ€™ Eve with Ryan Seacrest , HUNTR/X singers REI AMI, EJAE and Audrey Nuna opened up about which moments from the past 12 months shined the brightest.  Related HUNTR/X (AUDREY NUNA, EJAE & REI AMI), Zara Larsson, Demi Lovato & More Reveal Their Top 2025 Moments & More | Billboard News Chappell Roan, Mariah Carey & More Set for Expanded ‘Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rockin’ Eve’ Special HUNTR/Xâ€™s â€˜Goldenâ€™ Fends Off Holiday Competition to Reach No. 1 on Billboardâ€™s Radio Songs Chart In the video published Tuesday (Dec. 30) â€” just one day before the trio is set to take the stage in New York Cityâ€™s Times Square to help usher viewers into 2026 â€” the voices behind Netflixâ€™s fictional girl group struggled to name just one “pinch me” moment to define their 2025. “This whole year was a ‘pinch me’ year,” remarked EJAE. “For me it was the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade,” Ami said, referencing the ladies’ â€¦

title: This Official â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ Childrenâ€™s Book IsÂ MadeÂ for theÂ â€˜Littleâ€™Â Fans â€“ ShopÂ Here
summary: The illustrated Little Golden Books title is available to purchase on Amazon and at Barnes & Noble.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Based on the hit Netflix animated film, Little Golden Book has just dropped a KPop Demon Hunters book, aptly titled For the Fans! (KPop Demon Hunters): Official Storybook. Created by Angela Song, this official illustrated book hit shelves Dec. 30 and is available to shop now at Amazon for a $6.51 hardcover version or $5.99 for a Kindle version and at Barnes & Noble for $6.99 hardcover and $5.99 for an eBook version. Just like the movie, this book centers around the talented demon-slaying girl group HUNTR/X with members Rumi, Mira and Zoey. For the Fans! (KPop Demon Hunters): Official Storybook (Little Golden Books) $6.51 Buy Now On Amazon A KPop Demon Hunters book from Little Golden Books. As you read, you’ll also meet the Saja Boys, the hottest demon boy band, along with beloved animal characters like Derpy Tiger and Sussie. The illustrations, done by Little Golden Books, are absolutely adorable and come in a stylized chibi fashion in capâ€¦

title: Microbiology
summary: Microorganisms and Spaceflight Spaceflight poses a risk of adverse health effects due to the interactions between microorganisms, their hosts, and their environment. The JSC Microbiology team addresses the benefits and risks related to microorganisms, including infectious disease, allergens, enviroâ€¦
body: 2 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) Microbiology Laboratory at JSC NASA. Microorganisms and Spaceflight Spaceflight poses a risk of adverse health effects due to the interactions between microorganisms, their hosts, and their environment. The JSC Microbiology team addresses the benefits and risks related to microorganisms, including infectious disease, allergens, environmental and food contamination, and the impacts of changes in environmental and human microbial ecology aboard spacecraft. The team includes certified medical technologists, environmental microbiologists, mycologists, and biosafety professionals. The JSC Microbiology laboratory is a critical component of the Human Health and Performance Directorate and is responsible for addressing crew health and environmental issues related to microbial infection, allergens, and contamination. This responsibility is achieved by operational monitoring and investigative research using classical microbiological, advanced molecular, and immunohistochemical techniques. This research has resulted in a significant number of presentations and peer-reviewed publications contributing to the field â€¦

title: Here Is Every Taylor Swift Album Cover,Â Ranked
summary: From her self-titled debut to 'The Life of a Showgirl,' here's our ranking of every Taylor Swift album cover.
body: Itâ€™s impossible to deny Taylor Swift â€™s impact on music. With hundreds of songs and dozens of hits, she’s a master singer-songwriter with countless awards â€“ including the only artist to win the album of the year at the Grammys four times. But a music career isnâ€™t only about music â€” itâ€™s about the visual execution too. And though the age-old saying â€œdonâ€™t judge a book by its coverâ€ is generally true, an album cover can play a big role in making it memorable. For Swift, a handful of her biggest albums feature some of the most memorable art. When 1989 was released in 2014, for example, everyone from Swifties to casual listeners attempted their re-creations of the iconic half-face Polaroid cover. And that album went on to win album of the year at the Grammys. At the same time, not all hit covers are hit albums, and vice versa. So Billboard decided to rank each of the pop starâ€™s covers since her debut in 2006. Now, let’s be clear: This list is only taking album artwork into account â€“ not the merit of the music itself. Weâ€™re simply looking at covers: filters, styling, framing and how the creative represents the album as a whole. And, yes, this list is completely subjective, â€¦

title: NASAâ€™s Chandra Rings in New Year With Champagne Cluster
summary: Celebrate the New Year with the â€œChampagne Cluster,â€ a galaxy cluster seen in this new image from NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory and optical telescopes. Astronomers discovered this galaxy cluster Dec. 31, 2020. The date, combined with the bubble-like appearance of the galaxies and the superheatedâ€¦
body: X-ray: NASA/CXC/UCDavis/F. Bouhrik et al.; Optical:Legacy Survey/DECaLS/BASS/MzLS; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/P. Edmonds and L. Frattare Celebrate the New Year with the â€œChampagne Cluster,â€ a galaxy cluster seen in this new image from NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory and optical telescopes. Astronomers discovered this galaxy cluster Dec. 31, 2020. The date, combined with the bubble-like appearance of the galaxies and the superheated gas seen with Chandra observations (represented in purple), inspired the scientists to nickname the galaxy cluster the Champagne Cluster, a much easier-to-remember name than its official designation of RM J130558.9+263048.4. The new composite image shows that the Champagne Cluster is actually two galaxy clusters in the process of merging to form an even larger cluster. Multimillion-degree gas in galaxy clusters usually takes on an approximately circular or moderately oval shape in images, but in the Champagne Cluster it is more widely spread from top to bottom, revealing the presence of the two colliding clusters. Two clumps of individual galaxies making up the colliding clusters can be seen toward the top and bottom of center. (The image has been â€¦

title: Michael Lippman, Who Guided Careers of George Michael, David Bowie and Rob Thomas, Dies atÂ 79
summary: The fierce artist advocate helped define music management across five decades.
body: Michael Lippman , a formidable artist manager, label executive, and lawyer whose fierce advocacy and sharp deal-making helped shape modern pop stardom, died on Dec. 29. He was 79. The cause of death has not been disclosed. Lippman began his professional life far from the spotlight, working in the legal world under celebrity attorney Marvin Mitchelson. That experience opened the door to the entertainment business, leading him to a position in the soundtracks department at Columbia Pictures.  Related Howie Klein, Longtime Reprise President and Free Speech Advocate, Dies at 77 Kennedy Center President to 'Seek $1 Million in Damages' From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show Diddy Seeks Immediate Release From Prison in Appeals Argument His breakthrough in the music business came through his work as David Bowie â€™s lawyer during his rise to stardom in the 1970s. Lippman worked closely with Bowie during The Man Who Fell to Earth , Aladdin Sane and other classic albums, supported his genre and culture-crossing Soul Train appearance, and was present during the run-up to Bowieâ€™s first No. 1 on the Hot 100, “Fame.” He famously represented Bowie duriâ€¦

body: Explore This Section Earth Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner Feature Articles Meeting Summaries News Science in the News Calendars In Memoriam Announcements More Archives Conference Schedules Style Guide 37 min read The Earth Observer: Offering Perspectives from Space through Time An Intertwined History: The Earth Observer and EOS The Earth Observer , a newsletter issued for more than 36 years, will release its last online content at the close of 2025. This newsletter evolved in parallel with NASAâ€™s Earth Observing System (EOS). It is almost impossible to speak of this newsletter without mentioning EOS. As The Earth Observer prepares its final publication, NASA also plans to shutter its three EOS flagship satellites (discussed below) possibly as early as the end of 2026. While EOS was â€œmuch more than its satellites,â€ one cannot deny that the satellite missions and their iconic images provide an entry point to the overarching work conducted by the EOS science teams for almost three decades. These efforts spanned crucial complementary ground- and aircraft-based observations along with focused field campaigns to coordinate observations across multiple levels of Earth system time and spaâ€¦

title: Terra: The End of An Era
summary: Introduction Launched into the night sky nearly 26 years ago, on December 19, 1999, from Vandenberg Air Force Base (now Space Force Base), Terra was NASAâ€™s first Earth Observing System (EOS) Flagship mission to study Earthâ€™s land surface from space via a coordinated series of polar-orbiting and lowâ€¦
body: Explore This Section Earth Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner Feature Articles Meeting Summaries News Science in the News Calendars In Memoriam Announcements More Archives Conference Schedules Style Guide 27 min read Terra: The End of An Era Introduction Launched into the night sky nearly 26 years ago, on December 19, 1999, from Vandenberg Air Force Base (now Space Force Base), Terra was NASAâ€™s first Earth Observing System (EOS) Flagship mission to study Earthâ€™s land surface from space via a coordinated series of polar-orbiting and low-inclination satellites that produce long-term global observations useful for understanding the interactions between Earthâ€™s atmosphere, land, snow and ice, oceans, and radiant energy balance. Scheduled for a six-year tour, Terra outlasted its life expectancy by nearly two decades. Despite its longevity, Terraâ€™s mission scientists stopped making inclination adjustments in 2020, allowing the satellite to slowly drift out of its contained orbit. The mission team has also begun the painful process of shutting down the five key instruments as the satellite is prepped for retirement. â€œTerraâ€™s impressive human legacy stems from the fact that the missionâ€™s histâ€¦

title: The Final Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner: Octoberâ€“December 2025

No new content will be published after Dec. 31, 2025. While the sunset of The Earth Observer is bittersweet for our team, the good news â€¦
body: Explore This Section Earth Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner Feature Articles Meeting Summaries News Science in the News Calendars In Memoriam Announcements More Archives Conference Schedules Style Guide 14 min read The Final Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner: Octoberâ€“December 2025 It is with a heavy heart that I announce that NASA Earth Science Communications has directed The Earth Observer to conduct an orderly shutdown of the publication. No new content will be published after Dec. 31, 2025. While the sunset of The Earth Observer is bittersweet for our team, the good news is that all of the rich historical and descriptive content preserved on The Earth Observer â€™s archives page will remain accessible to the world. If youâ€™ve never checked this page out, I highly encourage you to do so. Youâ€™ll find all of our archived issues saved in a PDF format, and â€“ if you scroll down the page â€“ youâ€™ll find an annotated bibliography with links to numerous entries about a variety of topics to provide the historic context of the progress and accomplishments of the Earth Observing System (EOS). â€“ Alan Ward , Executive Editor, The Earth Observer More than 36 years ago, in March 1989, the first issue ofâ€¦

title: The State of CERES: Updates and Highlights
summary: Introduction The Clouds and the Earthâ€™s Radiant Energy System (CERES) was initially designed in the late-1980s and early-1990s as a facility instrument for NASAâ€™s Earth Observing System (EOS). Since its inception, NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center (LaRC) has led this effort. CERES has a long history wâ€¦
body: Explore This Section Earth Earth Observer Editorâ€™s Corner Feature Articles Meeting Summaries News Science in the News Calendars In Memoriam Announcements More Archives Conference Schedules Style Guide 42 min read The State of CERES: Updates and Highlights Introduction The Clouds and the Earthâ€™s Radiant Energy System (CERES) was initially designed in the late-1980s and early-1990s as a facility instrument for NASAâ€™s Earth Observing System (EOS). Since its inception, NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center (LaRC) has led this effort. CERES has a long history with seven different instruments flying on five different missions since 1997. As of today, six CERES instruments remain in orbit â€“ two are no longer operational: the Proto-Flight Model (PFM) unit flew on the Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM) and functioned for a brief period, and FM2, which was powered-off in January 2025 due to battery constraints on Terra. The active CERES instruments are found on Terra (FM1), Aqua (FM3 and 4), the Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership (Suomi NPP) (FM5), and the first Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS-1) mission, now known as NOAA-20 (FM6). Suomi NPP and the JPSS mission are partnershipsâ€¦

title: 2025 Space Station Science Snapshots
summary: 2025 marks another year pushing the boundaries of scientific research aboard the International Space Station. This past year, over 750 investigations were conducted aboard the space station, supported by crewed missions and resupply vehicles delivering essential cargo and experiments to the orbitinâ€¦
body: 1 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) NASA astronaut Zena Cardman processes bone cell samples inside the Kibo laboratory module’s Life Science Glovebox. NASA 2025 marks another year pushing the boundaries of scientific research aboard the International Space Station. This past year, over 750 investigations were conducted aboard the space station, supported by crewed missions and resupply vehicles delivering essential cargo and experiments to the orbiting laboratory. This yearâ€™s research included testing DNAâ€™s ability to store data, producing vital nutrients on demand, demonstrating technology for space debris removal and satellite maintenance, advancing next-generation medicines, and more. Astronauts visited the space station from across the globe to continue research benefiting humanity on Earth and paving the way for future exploration missions, including NASAâ€™s Artemis program to return humanity to the Moon. On Nov. 2, 2025, NASA and its international partners surpassed 25 years of continuous human presence aboard the space station, showcasing humanityâ€™s dedication to space exploration and scientific discovery. Over a million imagâ€¦

title: NASA to Preview US Spacewalks at Space Station in January
summary: NASA astronauts will conduct a pair of spacewalks in January outside of the International Space Station to prepare for the installation of a roll-out solar array and complete other tasks. Experts from NASA will preview the spacewalks in a briefing at 2 p.m. EST Tuesday, Jan. 6, at NASAâ€™s Johnson Spâ€¦
body: NASA astronaut and Expedition 72 Flight Engineer Nichole Ayers is pictured during a spacewalk to upgrade the orbital outpost’s power generation system and relocate a communications antenna. Credit: NASA NASA astronauts will conduct a pair of spacewalks in January outside of the International Space Station to prepare for the installation of a roll-out solar array and complete other tasks. Experts from NASA will preview the spacewalks in a briefing at 2 p.m. EST Tuesday, Jan. 6, at NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Watch NASAâ€™s live coverage of the news conference on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. Participants include: Bill Spetch, operations integration manager, International Space Station Program Diana Trujillo, spacewalk flight director, Flight Operations Directorate Heidi Brewer, spacewalk flight director, Flight Operations Directorate Media interested in participating in person or by phone must contact the NASA Johnson newsroom no later than 10 a.m., Monday, Jan. 5, by calling 281-483-5111 or emailing jsccommu@mail.nasa.gov . To ask questions by phone, reporters must dial â€¦

title: A Galactic Embrace
summary: Mid-infrared data from NASAâ€™s James Webb Space Telescope (in white, gray, and red) and X-ray data from NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory (in blue) come together in this photo of colliding spiral galaxies released on Dec. 1, 2025. The pair grazed one another millions of years ago; billions of years iâ€¦
body: X-ray: NASA/CXC/SAO; Infrared: NASA/ESA/CSA/STScI/Webb; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/L. Frattare Mid-infrared data from NASAâ€™s James Webb Space Telescope (in white, gray, and red) and X-ray data from NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory (in blue) come together in this photo of colliding spiral galaxies released on Dec. 1, 2025. The pair grazed one another millions of years ago; billions of years in the future, they will merge into a single galaxy. Image credit: X-ray: NASA/CXC/SAO; Infrared: NASA/ESA/CSA/STScI/Webb; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/L. Frattare
